perturbation.original_text: This WEB SITE HOSTING AGREEMENT ("this Agreement") is entered into this 6th day of April, 1999 by and between Centrack International, a Florida corporation ("the Customer"), and i-on interactive, a Florida corporation ("i-on").
perturbation.changed_text: This WEB SITE HOSTING AGREEMENT ("this Agreement") is entered into this 6th day of April, 1999 by and between Centrack International, a Florida corporation ("the Client"), and i-on interactive, a Florida corporation ("i-on").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Customer' is changed to 'Client' in the introduction. This sets up the possibility for confusion later if the document uses both terms interchangeably without clarifying if they refer to the same entity.

perturbation.original_text:
RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE CUSTOMER

The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
perturbation.changed_text:
RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE CLIENT

The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Client is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Client acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
perturbation.explanation: The section title now uses "Client," but the text inside uses both "Customer" and "Client." This creates confusion as to which entity is ultimately responsible for payments. It becomes ambiguous whether the responsibilities outlined apply to only the 'Client', only the 'Customer,' or both.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, no termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever shall relieve the Customer of the obligation to pay all amounts due to i-on and to make such payments on a timely basis.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, no termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever shall relieve the Client of the obligation to pay all amounts due to i-on and to make such payments on a timely basis.
perturbation.explanation: This section specifies that the 'Client' remains obligated to pay upon termination, despite the earlier sections using both 'Client' and 'Customer' to define payment responsibilities. This creates a direct contradiction that makes the agreement difficult to enforce.
